discussion.content:

CUBE's integrated voice-policy goes beyond static white/black lists to policy-based evaluation of call patterns and media flows, to prevent abuses such as toll fraud or telephony denial of service.

questions.question_text: What makes Cisco Unified Border Element a better choice than a conventional Session Border Controller?
What are two valid features of Cisco Unified Survivable Remote Site Telephony? (Choose two.)

choices.C: Using a Cisco router, it provides failover between these routers to ensure remote site operations.
choices.B: To get SIP trunk failover capability for Cisco UCM.
choices.A: Allows users to make calls with the same dial-plan as if connected to Cisco UCM cluster.
choices.E: Enables failover between two or more Cisco UCM servers in a cluster if one server is placed at a remote site.
choices.D: On a router registers all phones to that remote site router if link to the central Cisco UCM cluster is lost.

discussion.content:
Based on the document search, two valid features of Cisco Unified Survivable Remote Site Telephony (SRST) are:

A. Allows users to make calls with the same dial-plan as if connected to Cisco UCM cluster.
D. On a router registers all phones to that remote site router if the link to the central Cisco UCM cluster is lost.

These features ensure that in the event of a WAN failure, the SRST router takes over local call processing, allowing phones to register and continue making calls using the same dial plan. These features are described in the context of ensuring survivability and continuity of service during network outages

choices.D: a template used to configure a QoS policy in Cisco Prime Infrastructure
choices.B: a macro that enables VoIP QoS configuration on Cisco switches and routers by following best practices
choices.C: an application that automates the deployment of QoS by using Cisco APIC-EM
choices.A: an enterprise architecture framework that automates the deployment of QoS

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
EasyQoS is an application that runs on top of APIC-EM. Hence, it is an integral part of the overall Cisco DNA architecture. The EasyQoS solution abstracts QoS policy by using a declarative model as opposed to an imperative model. A declarative model focuses on the intent or WHAT is to be accomplished, without describing HOW it is to be accomplished. For example, a network operator may express that an application such as Cisco Jabber is business-relevantmeaning that it is to be treated with the appropriate servicebut he/she does not specify the details of how the QoS/QoE policies are to be configured in order to achieve this intent.
Cisco EasyQoS Solution Design Guide, APIC-EM Release 1.6

The correct statement about EasyQoS is:

C. an application that automates the deployment of QoS by using Cisco APIC-EM.

This information can be found in the document, which explains that EasyQoS automates the configuration of Quality of Service (QoS) settings by leveraging the Cisco Application Policy Infrastructure Controller Enterprise Module (APIC-EM)

Selected Answer: C
C is the correct answer. EasyQos is an application not a framework

choices.B: Set up media ports for each port group to use IPv4.
choices.D: Set up IPv4 and IPv6 in Cisco UCM.
choices.C: Set up for each group to use IPv4 and IPv6.

questions.question_text: Regarding SIP integrations with Cisco UCM, if the Cisco Unity Connection is configured to listen for incoming IPv4 and IPv6 traffic, how is the addressing mode set up in the Cisco Unity Connection?

discussion.content: C. Set up for each group to use IPv4 and IPv6.

The correct traversal client that must be deployed in an enterprise network when Mobile and Remote Access (MRA) is configured is:

B. Cisco Expressway-C

This is because Expressway-C handles the traversal client role, communicating with Expressway-E which acts as the traversal server to provide secure access and firewall traversal for endpoints registering with Cisco Unified Communications Manager from outside the enterprise network
